title: rustc-1.57.0: hang while building gkrust for firefox 91.0.1

labels.name: I-hang
labels.description: Issue: The compiler never terminates, due to infinite loops, deadlock, livelock, etc.

body:
```
LLVM        : 12.0.1
kernel      : Linux DellXPS 5.7.0 #4 SMP Mon Nov 2 16:45:10 JST 2020 x86_64 GNU/Linux
Xorg server : 1.20.9
g++ / gcc   : 10.2.0
misc        : custom system built entirely from source code
rustc       : 1.57.0

cpu      : Core 2 Quad Q9550 2.83GHz
flags    : fpu vme de pse tsc msr pae mce cx8 apic sep mtrr pge mca cmov
           pat pse36 clflush dts acpi mmx fxsr sse sse2 ht tm pbe syscall
           nx lm constant_tsc arch_perfmon pebs bts rep_good nopl cpuid
           aperfmperf pni dtes64 monitor ds_cpl vmx smx est tm2 ssse3
           cx16 xtpr pdcm sse4_1 lahf_lmpti tpr_shadow vnmi flexpriority
           vpid dtherm

graphics : AMDGPU(0): Chipset: "Radeon RX 580 Series" (ChipID = 0x67df)

```

The following command hangs causing the entire build to hang :
```
CARGO=/usr/bin/cargo CARGO_CRATE_NAME=gkrust_shared CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR=/home/jhart/temp/firefox-91.0.1/toolkit/library/rust/shared CARGO_PKG_AUTHORS='nobody@mozilla.org' CARGO_PKG_DESCRIPTION='Shared
```
